channel.title: CVE Feed for honojs -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for honojs -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-48913|2024-10-15T15:56:14.408Z -- honojs -- hono
item.description: Hono, a web framework, prior to version 4.6.5 is vulnerable to bypass of cross-site request forgery (CSRF) middleware by a request without Content-Type header. Although the CSRF middleware verifies the Content-Type Header, Hono always considers a request without a Content-Type header to be safe. This can allow an attacker to bypass CSRF protection implemented with Hono CSRF middleware. Version 4.6.5 fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-43787|2024-08-22T14:23:44.025Z -- honojs -- hono
item.description: Hono is a Web application framework that provides support for any JavaScript runtime. Hono CSRF middleware can be bypassed using crafted Content-Type header. MIME types are case insensitive, but isRequestedByFormElementRe only matches lower-case. As a result, attacker can bypass csrf middleware using upper-case form-like MIME type. This vulnerability is fixed in 4.5.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-32869|2024-08-02T02:20:35.658Z -- honojs -- hono
item.description: Hono is a Web application framework that provides support for any JavaScript runtime. Prior to version 4.2.7, when using serveStatic with deno, it is possible to traverse the directory where `main.ts` is located. This can result in retrieval of unexpected files. Version 4.2.7 contains a patch for the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-32869|2024-06-04T17:51:58.986Z -- honojs -- hono
item.description: Hono is a Web application framework that provides support for any JavaScript runtime. Prior to version 4.2.7, when using serveStatic with deno, it is possible to traverse the directory where `main.ts` is located. This can result in retrieval of unexpected files. Version 4.2.7 contains a patch for the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-32652|2024-06-04T17:52:02.191Z -- honojs -- node-server
item.description: The adapter @hono/node-server allows you to run your Hono application on Node.js. Prior to 1.10.1, the application hangs when receiving a Host header with a value that `@hono/node-server` can't handle well. Invalid values are those that cannot be parsed by the `URL` as a hostname such as an empty string, slashes `/`, and other strings. The version 1.10.1 includes the fix for this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-32652|2024-08-02T02:13:40.330Z -- honojs -- node-server
item.description: The adapter @hono/node-server allows you to run your Hono application on Node.js. Prior to 1.10.1, the application hangs when receiving a Host header with a value that `@hono/node-server` can't handle well. Invalid values are those that cannot be parsed by the `URL` as a hostname such as an empty string, slashes `/`, and other strings. The version 1.10.1 includes the fix for this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-43787|2024-08-22T15:40:32.051Z -- honojs -- hono
item.description: Hono is a Web application framework that provides support for any JavaScript runtime. Hono CSRF middleware can be bypassed using crafted Content-Type header. MIME types are case insensitive, but isRequestedByFormElementRe only matches lower-case. As a result, attacker can bypass csrf middleware using upper-case form-like MIME type. This vulnerability is fixed in 4.5.8.
